result.execSummary:
The defendant Amos A Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must report to Probation by 3:00 PM on Friday, September 16, 2016.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Probation Agent must approve the Defendant to have any contact with Ashley S.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Must report to Barron County Jail on Tuesday, September 20, 2016, between 1:00 and 5:00 PM.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amos A Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amos A Smith in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 16CF276 & 16CM51.

State moves to amend both charges to remove the domestic abuse enhancer. Court grants amendment.

16CF276 - Defendant pleads guilty to Count 2. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty.
16CM51 - Defendant pleads guilty. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty.

Argument by State. Argument by Defense. Defendant addresses the court.
Court relates and orders on both 16CF276 & 16CM51:

Sentence withheld - 1 year probation. Must report by 3:00 PM on Friday, September 16, 2016.

Probation agent must approve the Defendant to have any contact with Ashley S.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Costs.
Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Report to Barron County Jail on Tuesday, September 20, 2016, between 1:00 and 5:00 PM.

Clerked by AB. 
Defendant Amos A Smith in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. THIS COVERS 16CF276 AND 16CM51.
Qualifies for Public Defender.  Attorney Raymond moves to dismiss Count 1.  State relates.  Court dismisses Count 1.  Reading of Complaint waived.  Not guilty plea entered to Count 2.  State moves to revoke diversion court agreement in underlying case 16CM51.  Bond set.  Both cases set for  Plea hearing scheduled for September 14, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Amos A Smith in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has paid the $50.00 Diversion Court Fee. Programming discussed.
Objective: Enroll and complete in programming.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 28, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Amos A Smith in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

DPA filed.  Must have $50.00 paid by May 9, 2016.  Bond continues.
  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 16, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Amos A Smith in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Plea hearing scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Notice of Completion of No Contact Class

Defendant Amos A Smith in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense waives reading of complaint.  Plea of Not Guilty.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.  
Must have no contact with Ashley S.

Defendant Amos A Smith in court with attorney Ryan W O'Hara.  John Michael O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives formal reading of Complaint.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 10:00 am.
